Awards to Dependents of Institutionalized, Incompetent Veterans
Generally, the full monthly rate otherwise payable, less the reduced rate paid to the institution, may be apportioned to the dependent(s) of an institutionalized, incompetent Veteran.
The table below provides references to blocks within this topic that describe the action to take when an incompetent Veteran that is entitled to pension
is receiving institutional care by the U.S. or a political subdivision thereof, and
has a spouse, child, or dependent parent who is not being adequately provided for by an award to a fiduciary.
